meanings.sent1: The snary vines blocked our path through the forest.
meanings.sent2: Her hair became snary after playing outside all day.
meanings.sent3: The snary rope tied the two trees together in a knot.
meanings.sent4: The snary branches intertwined like a puzzle in the dense thicket.
meanings.sent5: The snary yarn was impossible to unravel without patience.

meanings.definition: Snary (verb): to become tangled or twisted
meanings.sent1: I accidentally snary my headphones while trying to untangle them.
meanings.sent2: The thread snaryed around the needle as she sewed.
meanings.sent3: The garden hose seemed to snary itself up every time we used it.
meanings.sent4: The plot of the mystery novel began to snary as the clues unfolded.
meanings.sent5: The traffic snaryed as more cars tried to merge into the lane.

meanings.definition: Snary (adverb): in a tangled or twisted manner
meanings.sent1: The rope was wound snary around the pole.
meanings.sent2: She danced snary through the crowd at the concert.
meanings.sent3: The cat's tail twitched snary as it played with the string.
meanings.sent4: The river flowed snary around the rocks in the stream.
meanings.sent5: The branches swayed snary in the wind during the storm.
